definition: lit. to lie on firewood and taste gall (idiom); fig. suffering patiently, but firmly resolved on revenge
variant of 嘗|尝[chang2]/to taste/to experience
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)

sentences.english: You think it was the resolution of Goujian, the Yue king?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲是越王勾踐臥薪嚐膽發奮勵志？

sentences.english: The King of Yue, Gou Jian submitted and sued for peace.
sentences.chinese: 後越王勾踐臥薪嚐膽，任用文種和范蠡重振國政。

sentences.english: Why choose Gou yield and Revival.
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼勾踐要選擇屈服和臥薪嚐膽。

sentences.english: This is the story of hardships known Gou same.
sentences.chinese: 這與家喻戶曉的勾踐臥薪嚐膽的典故如出一轍。

sentences.english: Maybe the rules of intimacy are something you have to define for yourself.
sentences.chinese: 也許，關於親密，你只能自己定義，靠自己臥薪嚐膽。

sentences.english: Story on the hardships do not tell us the virtues of patience it?
sentences.chinese: 臥薪嚐膽的故事不就告訴我們忍耐的美德嗎？

sentences.english: Good people, days, three thousand more can sleep on the brushwood, swallow wu.
sentences.chinese: 苦心人，天不負，臥薪嚐膽，三千越甲可吞吳。
